pullRequest.title: Fixing anchors and links in documentation
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR fixed link anchors and cross references in the documentation.
In order for a link to work:

the file needs to exist
anchors are case sensitive
local references within a file should start with #
the idprefix/idseparator are set up like on the live site of Quarkus (that is no prefixed underscore)

nodes.bodyText: Hmmm, these links are working correctly on the website. Is it only an issue when you generate locally?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,8 +21,8 @@ To complete this guide, you need:
 * less than 15 minutes
 * an IDE
 * JDK 8 installed with `JAVA_HOME` configured appropriately
-* A xref:configuring-c-development[working C development environment]
-* GraalVM version {graalvm-version} installed and xref:configuring-graalvm[configured appropriately]
+* A xref:#configuring-c-development[working C development environment]
+* GraalVM version {graalvm-version} installed and xref:#configuring-graalvm[configured appropriately]

@@ -90,7 +90,7 @@ Installing via scoop will do this for you.
 ${GRAALVM_HOME}/bin/gu install native-image
 ----
 +
-Some previous releases of GraalVM included the `native-image` tool by default.  This is no longer the case; it must be installed as a second step after GraalVM itself is installed. Note: there is an outstanding issue xref:graal-and-catalina[using GraalVM with macOS Catalina].
+Some previous releases of GraalVM included the `native-image` tool by default.  This is no longer the case; it must be installed as a second step after GraalVM itself is installed. Note: there is an outstanding issue xref:#graal-and-catalina[using GraalVM with macOS Catalina].
